 3.3 - INPUT ASSISTANCE
REDUNDANT ENTRY(LEVEL A)
On accessible websites...

[New]

Information previously entered by or provided to the user that is required to be
entered again in the same process is either:

 * auto-populated, or
 * available for the user to select.

Except when:

 * re-entering the information is essential,
 * the information is required to ensure the security of the content, or
 * previously entered information is no longer valid.

These websites...

Help users avoid and correct mistakes.

WHAT'S AN EXAMPLE?
A search results page pre-fills the search input with the previously entered
search term in the same process. Iâ€™d like to know a little more
[https://www.w3.org/WAI/WCAG22/Understanding/redundant-entry.html#examples]

Web Content Accessibility Guidelines 2.2, W3C World Wide Web Consortium
Recommendation 05 October 2023 (https://www.w3.org/TR/2023/REC-WCAG22-20231005/,
Latest version at https://www.w3.org/TR/WCAG22/)
